es.us.alumn.miggoncan2.model.entities

Class ShiftCycle

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.us.alumn.miggoncan2.model.entities.ShiftCycle

  • @Entity
public class ShiftCycle
extends java.lang.Object
    Doctors have some periodic shifts. This is, if some Doctors have a shift today, after a certain number of days, they will have another one. This kind of shifts will be refered to as "cycle-shift", and should not be confused with regular shifts. A "regular shift", or "shift" in short, refers to the shifts that will vary from month to month and that do not occur periodically. This way, the ShiftCycle Entity represents one recurring cycle-shift taken by several Doctors
    Author:
    miggoncan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private @NotEmpty java.util.List<Doctor> doctors
      The List of Doctors that have this cycle-shift
      private @NotNull java.lang.Boolean isNextShiftInCycle
      This field will indicate which doctors will have the first cycle-shift the next time shifts are scheduled
      private @Positive java.lang.Integer shiftNumber
      shiftNumber number this cycle-shift represents within all shift-cycles For example, if we had the following cycle: Day 1: Sebastian and Diana Day 2: Alex and Rasim Day 3: Irati and Laura Then, the shiftNumber of the cycle-shift "Sebastian and Diana" would be 1 (as of "Day 1") Moreover, the shiftNumbers should start from 1 and be increased one unit with every cycle-shift (just as seen in the example above)
